problem_text:
Let L be a non-abelian finite simple group, and let H(L) = M(L).L be the universal perfect central extension, where M(L) is the Schur multiplier of L. Suppose that G is a finite group such that the set of class sizes of G is the same as the set of class sizes of H(L). Is it true that G ≃ H(L) × A, where A is an abelian group?
This is proved for L = Alt5 in (J. Algebra Appl., 21, no. 11 (2022), Article ID 2250226, 8 p.).
I. B. Gorshkov
